00001 #include <stdio.h>
00002 #include <math.h>
00003 
00004 void Lgm_ComputeW( double W[], int i, double Nk[], double Vk[], double Bsk[], int nk ){
00005 
00006     /*
00007      *   Nk, Vk, Bsk are arrays of SW/IMF inputs. Assume they are 1 minute resolution.
00008      *
00009      *   Nk[] is array of solar wind density values from beginning of storm
00010      *   Vk[] is array of solar wind speed values from beginning of storm
00011      *   Bsk[] is array of IMF Bs values from beginning of storm
00012      *   nk is number of values in these arrays
00013      *
00014      *   i is the index of the current time
00015      *   W[] are the 6 W index parameters defined in T04S
00016      *
00017      */
00018      
00019 
00020 
00021 
00022     static double   Lambda[6] = { 0.39, 0.46, 0.39, 0.42, 0.41, 1.29 };
00023     static double   Beta[6]  = { 0.80, 0.18, 2.32, 1.25, 1.6, 2.4 };
00024     static double   Gamma[6] = { 0.87, 0.67, 1.32, 1.29, 0.69, 0.53 };
00025     static double   Rate[6]  = { 0.39, 0.7, 0.031, 0.58, 1.15, 0.88 };
00026     double          ti, tk, sum, Sk;
00027     int             k, q;
00028 
00029 
00030 
00031     
00032     /*
00033      *  Time is measured in minutes. But each step is 5 minutes so we need to multiply by 5 on the indices...
00034      */
00035     ti = (double)i*5.0;
00036 
00037     
00038     for (q=0; q<6; ++q) {
00039 
00040         for (sum=0.0, k=0; k<=i; ++k){
00041 
00042             tk = (double)k*5;
00043             Sk = pow( Nk[k]/5.0, Lambda[q] ) * pow( Vk[k]/400.0, Beta[q] ) * pow( Bsk[k]/5.0, Gamma[q] );
00044             sum += Sk*exp(Rate[q]/60.0*(tk-ti));
00045 
00046         }
00047         W[q] = Rate[q]/12.0*sum;
00048 
00049     }
00050 
00051 
00052 }
00053 /*
00054  *   $id$
00055  */
